title: Northwestern Shiprepairers & Shipbuilders
text:
Northwestern Shiprepairers & Shipbuilders was a British shiprepair <a href="company">company</a> based in <a href="Birkenhead">Birkenhead</a> on the <a href="River%20Mersey">River Mersey</a>.
History.
The Company was founded by John Syvret, a former <a href="Cammell%20Laird">Cammell Laird</a> manager, in 2001. In 2002 50% of the business was sold to <a href="Mersey%20Docks%20and%20Harbour%20Company">Mersey Docks & Harbour Co.</a> in exchange for the use of their <a href="dry%20dock">dry dock</a>s. Then in 2005 the Company acquired the former <a href="Cammell%20Laird">Cammell Laird</a> yard at Birkenhead from <a href="A%26amp%3BP%20Group">A&P Group</a>. In June 2008 the Company won an order to maintain 11 <a href="Royal%20Fleet%20Auxiliary">Royal Fleet Auxiliary</a> ships.
Having acquired the rights to the use of the "Cammell Laird" name, in November 2008 the Company changed its name to <a href="Cammell%20Laird">Cammell Laird Shiprepairers and Shipbuilders Ltd</a>.
